intro: Schwantesia triebneri, commonly known as the Triebner's Schwantesia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and orange, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained sandy soils and requires full sun exposure. Due to its unique appearance and drought tolerance, it is often cultivated in rock gardens and arid landscapes.
